channel.title: Amarok problem :S
channel.description:
well, for some reason when ever I try to boot up Amarok, it freezes after showing the splash screen. the only way I can get it to run is by using it under another user, meaning my library is empty every time.
Can anyone help me with this? It hasn't worked since I turned on the splash screen. but If it is crashing on the splash screen, how am I to change the settings for it? I already tried reinstalling it.

item.title: Amarok problem :S
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

thanks, but I got it working again(by sheer luck)

thanks anyway mopar, I’ll write that command down.

Read full topic

item.title: Amarok problem :S
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

you could apt-get --purge amarok and then install it again, that will remove all of your config files I think.

Read full topic

item.title: Amarok problem :S
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

I’m thinking about redoing linux again(reformating and brand new instalation)
things have been going haywire, programs are not responding or exiting as they should and even the file system’s manager(konqueror) wont work unless I go under Super User… I’m sick of things always messing up. Windows is being retarded right now because of “Spyware.perfect” and wont connect to anything, and linux is just being a sick baby right now…

Read full topic

item.title: Amarok problem :S
item.dc:creator: @Heaven Heaven
item.description:
@Heaven wrote:

If it isn’t working after reinstalling it, Then…well, your fucked. I didn’t use KDE much, and i think amarok is for KDE am i correct? I don’t really think you can change the settings without running it, i’d find another way to get to my music, put on audio disc(s) then reformat. That’s just me, i’m a noob with linux.

Read full topic
